review: Chromecast is amazingly simple to use and it streams high quality videos very well. I had it up and running in about 5 minutes, including downloading the app to my phone and laptop. I use it a lot to view videos of live music and other YouTube content. Depending on how it was recorded, the audio and the video are excellent (if the source is bad, playback is no better). Using my phone as a remote to queue up videos is very convenient. Chromecast does not interfere with other uses of the phone.  It works great with Netflix. It would be a 5 star but the breadth content is pretty limited at this moment (It would, for example, be great if there was Amazon Prime available). I understand that Google is working to expand the available content.
author: William S. Holland

review: Once you overcome the set-up, it's a pretty cool, useful device.  I could not set it up with my Samsung Chromebook, which seemed counter-intuitive since I ordered to Chromecast to use with the Chomebook.  In any event, I was able to use my daughter's ipod touch to set up the Chromecast on the HDTV (pretty easily actually) and then downloaded the Chromecast software to  the Chromebook and I was off and running.  It's great for sending a movie from Netflix on the Chromebook to the HDTV and I discovered you can actually close up the Chromebook and it seems to just keep streaming directly.  Pausing it or stopping and starting it will cause it to glitch, but if you just want to start a movie or tv show and watch right through this is a great device.
